pr_title: ConcurrentUtils cleanup, [Completable|Single]Processor cancel concurrency fix, Simplify Publisher#flatMapConcatIterable

timeline.message:
ConcurrentUtils cleanup, [Completable|Single]Processor cancel
concurrency fix, Simplify Publisher#flatMapConcatIterable

Motivation:
ConcurrentUtils has two variables that are public to support locking in a Reactive Stream's context: CONCURRENT_IDLE and CONCURRENT_EMITTING. We should explore if these variables can be made private and instead expose locking methods for better encapsulation and to ensure consistent usage.

Publisher#flatMapMergeSingle was updated in PR #1014 to avoid depending upon queue for visibility of draining/processing elements. We should update the other queue drain methods in ConcurrentUtils to use a consistent strategy.

[Completable|Single]Processor use a single consumer drain lock, but
cancel may occur from multiple threads. This may result in items
remaining in the queue for long periods of time until the outer
processor terminates.

Modifications:
- Make ConcurrentUtils defintions private
- Remove usage of drain*ConsumerQueue methods that don't require the single consumer queue semantics, and can instead use a ConcurrentLinkedQueue for simplified draining. This can also lead to lower memory footprint when queue sizes are anticipated to be small.
- Use ConcurrentLinkedQueue in [Completable|Single]Processor to avoid
items remaining in queue for prolonged periods of time.
- Simplify Publisher#flatMapConcatIterable as a result of new concurrent
utilities

Result:
Fixes https://github.com/apple/servicetalk/issues/1023
Fixes https://github.com/apple/servicetalk/issues/1024

timeline.bodyText: Should we worry about multiple exceptions while we iterate all subscribers? Can we left a comment describing why we take only the first cause and ignore others?
timeline.author: idelpivnitskiy

replies.bodyText:
Ok, I saw this discussion: #1011 (comment)
Can you please leave a comment in all such places for future contributors to help them understand this decision?
replies.author: idelpivnitskiy

replies.bodyText: I added a ThrowableUtils#catchUnexpected method to consolidate the usage and make it easier to change later if necessary (and added comments here).
replies.author: Scottmitch

timeline.author: NiteshKant

replies.bodyText: lets do this as a followup PR as you indicated it changes behavior/semantics and if we do relax constraints would be useful to have explicit PR/commit for release note notification.
replies.author: Scottmitch

timeline.bodyText: perhaps a good time to rename this method to indicate that it throws? eg: finishAndThrow()
timeline.author: NiteshKant

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/servicetalk-concurrent-api/src/main/java/io/servicetalk/concurrent/api/CompositeException.java b/servicetalk-concurrent-api/src/main/java/io/servicetalk/concurrent/api/CompositeException.java
index e2304b5b2..2dc8871c3 100644
--- a/servicetalk-concurrent-api/src/main/java/io/servicetalk/concurrent/api/CompositeException.java
+++ b/servicetalk-concurrent-api/src/main/java/io/servicetalk/concurrent/api/CompositeException.java

@@ -40,7 +40,7 @@ final class CompositeException extends RuntimeException {
 
     /**
      * Add a {@link Throwable} to be added as {@link #addSuppressed(Throwable)} on the next call to
-     * {@link #addAllPendingSuppressed()}.
+     * {@link #finishAndThrow()}.
      *
      * @param toAdd {@link Throwable} to finally add as {@link #addSuppressed(Throwable)}.
      */

timeline.author: NiteshKant

replies.bodyText:
i agree the existing name isn't ideal. I wanted to convey the lock state is 3 fold and there is a "hand off" if failure to acquire.
discussed offline and we will go with tryAcquireLock and releaseLock
replies.author: Scottmitch

timeline.bodyText: This is pre-existing but looks like we will invoke the target onError twice if strategy is Propagate, terminalNotification is non-null (from onError() above) and currentIterator.hasNext() throws.
timeline.author: NiteshKant
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -204,53 +194,32 @@ private void tryDrainIterator(Iterator<? extends U> currentIterator, Subscriptio
                         terminalNotification.terminate(target);

replies.bodyText: good catch .. I'll hard return our early
replies.author: Scottmitch

timeline.bodyText: Consider adding a comment that visibility is guaranteed by write/read of emitting lock
timeline.author: NiteshKant

timeline.bodyText: This may be a better in a separate PR but the control-flow here is still utterly confusing and there are cases we may throw from a finally block which is a debugging nightmare 🙂. It will be good to revisit the control flow at some point.
timeline.author: NiteshKant

replies.bodyText: I wanted to minimize change in this PR to focus on the concurrent utilities. lets consider more general simplification as a followup PR.
replies.author: Scottmitch

timeline.bodyText: Use SubscriberUtils.safeOnError in this and other branches here.
timeline.author: NiteshKant
NiteshKant

replies.bodyText: good question, lets handle this as a followup just to preserve ordering semantics in this PR and make the change more visible if/when it is made #1033
replies.author: Scottmitch

timeline.bodyText:
Can we avoid calling cancelAll() here as I suggested above for the queue variant?
Looks like we can concurrently invoke a Cancellable if cancelAll() is invoked concurrently.
timeline.author: NiteshKant

replies.bodyText: good call ... because of the Set interface we can't safely drain from multiple threads and process and item exactly once. This needs to use the tryAcquireLock method and I will fix.
replies.author: Scottmitch

timeline.bodyText: Use acquire() and release methods from above here too?
timeline.author: NiteshKant

replies.bodyText: This method is removed in #1014, so lets discuss on that PR and for now I'll avoid touching in this PR.
replies.author: Scottmitch

timeline.bodyText: Same suggestion as CompletableProcessor to remove the "invoke listeners in order" semantics.
timeline.author: NiteshKant

replies.bodyText: good point, lets discuss on #1033 and handle semantic change in a follow PR.
replies.author: Scottmitch

timeline.message: add throwable util for catching unepxected exceptions
